metadata.title: CVE-2019-17567 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.6 to 2.4.46 mod_proxy_wstunnel configuredon an URL that is not necessarily Upgraded by the origin server wastunneling the whole connection regardless, thus allowing for subsequentrequests on the same connection to pass through with no HTTP validation,authentication or authorization possibly configured.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.48-3ubuntu1
apache2-bin - 2.4.48-3ubuntu1
apache2-data - 2.4.48-3ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.48-3ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.48-3ubuntu1
apache2-utils - 2.4.48-3ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.48-3ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.48-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.48-3ubuntu1').
